0.Major_Activities1: Since its establishment the LNA has been able to provide opportunities for young girls both in a secular and monastic education and live in the nunnery with the spiritual nurturing and care of the older nuns. In promoting the role of nuns LNA has worked tirelessly in providing opportunities for them to obtain higher education in Buddhist Philosophy and in Amchi Traditional Tibetan Medicine Studies.Today LNA have nine Amchi Doctors and many of them working as a Government teachers in nunneries.

registeration_info.nr_add:
LADAKH NUNS ASSOCIATION
LOWER SKARA, P.O. BOX 157
G.H. ROAD, LEH LADAKH 194101
JAMMU AND KASHMIR

source_info.purpose: To empower the girls and women education of the remote areas. Our Amchis distribute free traditional medicine to needy people in villages. In our nunnery we have young nuns from different parts of Ladakh, all of them get free education,  health care and financial support to higher study throug the Ladakh Nuns Association. We organized workshops, seminars, conferences on women empowerment. We are very thankful and grateful to the Central Government for such great help and support to our nunnery.
We actively worked and completed 12 hostel rooms and Toilets from the sanctioned money. We have the plan to complete rest of the building in the near future as soon as we get the fund from MOC.
No grant and aid has been sanctioned by Govt. of India for our Association.
No grant and aid has been sanctioned by Govt. of India for our Association.
